tidbits.title: Diverse Wildlife
tidbits.description: South Africa is famous for its diverse wildlife, including the 'Big Five' (lion, leopard, rhinoceros, elephant, and buffalo) found in its numerous national parks.

tidbits.title: Nelson Mandela's Legacy
tidbits.description: The country's transition from apartheid to democracy was led by Nelson Mandela, the iconic anti-apartheid leader, and the first democratically elected President of South Africa.

tidbits.title: Cultural Mosaic
tidbits.description: South Africa is a vibrant melting pot of cultures, languages, and traditions, celebrated in its diverse music, cuisine, and festivals across the nation.
